intro: Asperula hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy woodruff, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive, textured appearance. It thrives in woodland areas and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Asperula hirsuta is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate blooms and aromatic foliage.
